intro: [WRONG START] Vetenata, commonly known as cheatgrass, is an invasive annual grass native to Eurasia. It thrives in disturbed soils and can rapidly colonize open areas, outcompeting native vegetation. Its rapid growth and early flowering cycle allow it to dominate ecosystems, often leading to reduced biodiversity. The plant has narrow, needle-like leaves and produces small, fluffy seeds that are easily dispersed by wind. Due to its aggressive growth, it is a significant concern in rangeland and restoration ecology.
